sentences.en: Coterie Liu Xinping tells a reporter.
sentences.cn: 圈内人刘新平告诉记者.

sentences.en: Helen won't bowl with us; she has her own coterie of bowling friends.
sentences.cn: 海伦不会跟我们打保龄球; 她自己有一群打保龄球的朋友.

sentences.en: Hong Kong's chief executive is chosen by a coterie of business leaders heavily influenced by Beijing.
sentences.cn: 香港特首是由深受北京影响的一群商业大佬选出来的.

sentences.en: It is in light of insurance coterie, it is really a little.
sentences.cn: 在保险圈内人来看, 的确是有点儿.

sentences.en: Mary and her coterie gave a party to which we were not invited.
sentences.cn: 玛利和她的圈内朋友举行派对,我们没被邀请.

sentences.en: The name is known to only a small coterie of collectors.
sentences.cn: 这个名字只有收藏家的小圈子才知道.

sentences.en: The songs he recorded were written by a small coterie of dedicated writers.
sentences.cn: 他录制的这些歌是由几名酷爱音乐的作曲家谱写的。

sentences.en: The verses were copied out , handed about , sneered at, admired, passed from coterie to coterie.
sentences.cn: 这些诗, 有人抄录,有人传阅, 有人鄙夷, 也有人赞美, 从一伙人传到另一伙人.

sentences.en: We three formed a little literary coterie.
sentences.cn: 我们三人组成一个小文学团体。

words.tran_cn: 圈内人；小集团；伙伴；同志

trans.tran_en: a small group of people who enjoy doing the same things together, and do not like including others
